title: Stone of Jas

properties.value: The Stone of Jas is a powerful artefact created and left behind by the Elder God Jas. According to Melzar, it was used by the gods to create all life and magic.[1] Like the Staff of Armadyl, it is coveted by mortals and gods alike for its immense power. The Stone is referred by Saradominists who know of its existence as "The Eye".

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Stone of Jas
"The Eye" redirects here. For the location that once housed the artefact, see Temple of the Eye (location). For other uses, see Eye (disambiguation).
Mysterious Stone
Released23 March 2022 (Update)
MembersYes
QuestTemple of the Eye
LocationUnknown
ExamineAn odd-looking stone.
Advanced data
Object ID43780

The Stone of Jas is a powerful artefact created and left behind by the Elder God Jas. According to Melzar, it was used by the gods to create all life and magic.[1] Like the Staff of Armadyl, it is coveted by mortals and gods alike for its immense power. The Stone is referred by Saradominists who know of its existence as "The Eye".

The Dragonkin operate as a defense mechanism for the Stone; they are cursed,[2] magically bound to the stone by Jas. The curse causes an uncontrollable rage to burn within them whenever the power of the stone is falsely used. This rage can only be sated by a rampage against the perpetrators. Fittingly, half of the Dragonkin emblem is the Stone of Jas, the other half being a compass rose.

The Stone appears to have peculiar creative properties, altering nearby material if left undisturbed over long periods of time; its influence can be seen today in the form of various essence mines found around the world. For example, in the First or Second Age, a Fremennik by the name of V------- stumbled upon the Stone on what is known today as Lunar Isle.[3][4] Though it was taken away immediately by "those powers who walk a higher Astral Path than ourselves [the Moon Clan]", its power had permanently altered the rocks in that cave, turning them into rune essence,[5] and resulting in the discovery of runecrafting.[6][7]

Other locations that the Stone was known to have rested in throughout time include the rune essence mines somewhere hidden in the frozen north, the dense essence mine of modern-day Great Kourend, and the essence mine beneath modern-day Darkmeyer, whose presence altered the nearby rocks to create daeyalt essence. In addition, it is known that the Stone once resided in the Temple of the Eye sometime during the God Wars.

The player getting visions of the past about the artefact known as "the Eye".

Sometime before the end of the Second Age, Zamorak was in possession of the Stone, though where he found it is not known, nor whether he used its power alongside the Staff of Armadyl during the Betrayal of Zaros. Some time after his triumph over Zaros, the other gods appeared and banished Zamorak from Gielinor.[8] During this time, possession of the Stone went to Saradomin, who then hid it beneath the waves somewhere south of Hallowvale. Aliya and Zachariah, Justiciars of the Lion and Owl, were tasked with protecting the artefact;[9] Aliya was tasked to build a temple to house the artefact,[10], while Zachariah was to hunt down and slay those who would try to claim it, including Porazdir, one of Zamorak's generals.[11]

Sometime during the God Wars, many sought to claim the Stone, including servants of Zaros.[12] One group managed to locate the Stone and attempted to use abyssal magic to steal it; however, it opened a rift to The Scar,[13] the most dangerous part of the Abyss.[14] As a result, abyssal creatures began to come through, and a battle was fought within the temple. Aliya used the Stone to seal the abyssal rift,[15] and created The Great Guardian and many other rune guardians to protect the temple in the event the rift was reopened.[16] She then moved the Stone to a cavern that what would later be named the Fist of Guthix.[17]

A plinth in the Daeyalt essence mine, which once held the Stone of Jas.

At the end of the Third Age, Zamorak would regain possession of the Stone. At some point, it was entrusted to Lowerniel Drakan, [17] where it would be in his possession for a long enough time that its presence created the daeyalt desposits.[18] While in his possession, Zamorak would use it to lay waste to Forinthry, creating the Wilderness and ending the God Wars through the god's banishment and the establishment of the Edicts of Guthix.

The Stone was subsequently taken away by unknown entities and moved to another unknown location.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Melzar's notes, Old School RuneScape. "Had dream last night of great cabbage. Cabbage of Jas. Used by Gods to create all life and magic. all runes have part of its power. so with runes I can control power above magic."
  2. ^ Zorgoth, Old School RuneScape. "Only a few gave in to the anger of the curse."
  3. ^ Moonclan manual, Old School RuneScape. "As we all know, from the tales told to us in the Secret Tongue, 'magic' was first discovered in these lands by V------- when he accidentally stumbled upon the Stone of J--."
  4. ^ Brundt the Chieftain, Old School RuneScape. "V was different. Stories tell of how he unlocked the potential of magic with the single touch of a stone."
  5. ^ Moonclan manual, Old School RuneScape. "he [V-------] did discover something of great importance in the caves where first he found the stone; the very rocks that had surrounded it had been subtly changed by its presence. The rocks in their contact with the Stone of J-- had gained a yearning to be something they were not."
  6. ^ Moonclan manual, Old School RuneScape. "...V------- discovered that by focussing thought upon them he could transform them entirely for short periods of time into the very elements of the universe."
  7. ^ Baba Yaga, Old School RuneScape. "The Fremennik were actually the first to discover how to make runes."
  8. ^ Viggora, Old School RuneScape. "It was then [after the Betrayal of Zaros] that the other gods appeared and banished Zamorak from the world completely for daring to kill one of their kind, although as it turned out it didn't quite work out that way for them, when he returned stronger than ever, a god himself."
  9. ^ Zachariah, Old School RuneScape. "...he [Saradomon] has given us the task of protecting it [the Eye]."
  10. ^ Zachariah, Old School RuneScape. "You must build a sanctuary for the Eye. The forces of chaos already seek to reobtain it, as do countless others."
  11. ^ Zachariah, Old School RuneScape. "Zamorak has tasked his collector with finding the Eye. I will hunt him down before he does, along with any others who would try to claim it."
  12. ^ The Great Guardian, Old School RuneScape. "This temple was built to house a powerful artefact. Many sought to claim this artefact for themselves, including servants of the Fallen Empire."
  13. ^ The Great Guardian, Old School RuneScape. "In their attempt to claim the artefact, they used magic they did not understand. The rift to the Scar was created as a result."
  14. ^ The Great Guardian, Old School RuneScape. "No part of the Abyss is more dangerous than the Scar."
  15. ^ The Great Guardian, Old School RuneScape. "The Eye was removed after the battle, but not before the Justiciar of the Lion used it to seal the rift once more."
  16. ^ The Great Guardian, Old School RuneScape. "She then created us, the Guardians of the Rift, to protect this place in the event the rift was ever reopened."
  17. ^ 17.0 17.1 Jagex. "Q&A Summary 07/04/2022". 12 April 2022. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News. "It [the Stone] was in the temple and after the temple was attacked, and the rift was opened, it wasn't safe to keep it there anymore so it got moved to The Fist of Guthix, and then later it was taken back to Morytania but at that point, it was by Zamorakians rather than Saradominists and it was entrusted to Drakan."
  18. ^ Noranna Tytanin, Old School RuneScape. "They say that an object of great power was once stored in this very cave. Apparently, the presence of this object created the daeyalt deposits."
